channel.title: Is it even possible to graph these and find a function?
channel.description:
So I recorded this data:
Ay | Vec ___ | ____ 0 | (0, 0, -0.67923) 332 | (0.31888, 0, -0.599732) 36 | (-0.39925, 0, -0.5495156) 200 | (0.23231329, 0, 0.63827552)
I went to put this into my calculator then it hit me... "How the fudge am I going to put this into my calculator.
How can I find a function that given variable "Ay", it returns the x and z values of the returning vector?
or is that not possible?
EDIT: Facepalm... I'm a bloody idiot, I could just pair the "Ay" up with all of the X's in the vector and the "Ay" with all of the Z's...

item.title: Is it even possible to graph these and find a function?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

So I recorded this data:

Ay | Vec
___ | ____
0 | (0, 0, -0.67923)
332 | (0.31888, 0, -0.599732)
36 | (-0.39925, 0, -0.5495156)
200 | (0.23231329, 0, 0.63827552)

I went to put this into my calculator then it hit me… "How the fudge am I going to put this into my calculator.

How can I find a function that given variable “Ay”, it returns the x and z values of the returning vector?

or is that not possible?

EDIT: Facepalm… I’m a bloody idiot, I could just pair the “Ay” up with all of the X’s in the vector and the “Ay” with all of the Z’s…

Read full topic
